What do the central figures on the cuirass depict?

options.A: Augustus and Agrippa after defeating Antony and Cleopatra at the Battle of Actium
options.B: Augustus and Antony after defeating Brutus and Cassius at the Battle of Philippi
options.C: the Parthian King restoring Crassus’ lost standards to Tiberius
options.D: the Gallic chieftain Vercingetorix paying homage to the triumphing Julius Caesar

questions.question: The drinking horn usually adorned with depictions of animal heads is called a Bound for sale in the East, and now on display in the National Museum of Athens:
The first permanent stone theater in Rome was the Theater of Bound for sale in the East, and now on display in the National Museum of Athens:

Paintings at both Herculaneum and Pompeii (e.g. the Three Graces, Hercules finding his son Telephus) were influenced by the paintings done at Bound for sale in the East, and now on display in the National Museum of Athens:
